pageContext.claim: “And today, an accuser who said she was raped admitted she was lying. Think of that. She was lying. She never met him. It didn't happen. Can you imagine? And -- and the Democrats were so horrible on everyone.”
pageContext.analysis: Christine Blasey Ford, the first woman who accused Brett Kavanaugh of sexually assaulting her, gave lengthy and detailed testimony to the Senate Judiciary Committee. She specifically said the alleged assault happened in 1982 and named three other people who were at the same gathering. Ford said she didn't remember many details. Trump initially said he found these accusations to be credible. A different woman whose story was not told as widely and did not testify recanted her allegations. But Trump creates a misleading impression because he doesn't specify to which Kavanaugh accuser he is referring.
